content.question: Which of the following statements best describes the harmonic and melodic content of measures 1â€“4 of the excerpt above?

choices.label: A rising harmonic sequence accompanies a melody that is not strictly sequential.
A rising harmonic sequence accompanies a sequential melodic fragment.
A falling harmonic sequence accompanies a melody that is not strictly sequential.
A harmonically static progression accompanies a sequential melodic fragment.

content.answer: A rising harmonic sequence accompanies a melody that is not strictly sequential.

unit.text: 6: Harmony and Voice Leading III - Embellishments, Motives, and Melodic Devices

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Use symbols and terms to describe melodic, harmonic, and rhythmic relationships in notated music. (This skill is applied in describing these elements in a full musical context.)
